cursed_version_of.description: This oracle is the cursed version of one or more oracles. Note that any wildcard matches with their own `cursed_version_of` tag should be ignored (and can safely be be omitted from curse die behavior altogether).

curse_behavior.description:
Only relevant if the `cursed_version_of` tag is present.
  * `replace_result`: Replace the original table result with the cursed table result, using the original table roll value.
  * `add_result`: Roll again on the cursed table, combining it with the original table result.

requires_allies.description: This object requires allies to function, and is intended only for co-op play, or guided play with allies. It is not appropriate for solo play.

cursed_by.description: This oracle has a cursed version.

supernatural.description: This object is supernatural in nature, and is ideal for settings that feature supernatural or mythic powers.

technological.description: This object is technological in nature, and is ideal for settings that feature remarkable technologies.

starforged_friendly.description: This asset is ideal for use in Starforged.

region.description: This oracle table or row relates to a specific region of the Sundered Isles.

overland_region.description: This oracle table or row relates to a specific overland region type.

location.description: This oracle table or row relates to a location type.

faction_type.description: This oracle table or row relates to a specific type of faction.

ship_size.description: This oracle table or row relates to a specific size of ship.

treasure_size.description: This oracle table or row relates to a specific size of treasure.

societies.name: Societies
societies.summary: People who share traditions and a way of life.

rows.text2: Coalition of clans known for their sleek and speedy ships. They gather each year to celebrate the ebb of the storm season, and hang rows of vibrantly colored flags from their rigging to honor the dead.
Once a single tribe, the loyalty of these people is divided between two rulers descended from rival heirs. They often war against one another, but now have a fragile alliance against a mutual foe.
Seagoing folk who build their homes and ships from luminous glimmerwood. This resource is harvested from the coastal swamps of their homeland, an environment under threat of destruction.

Warring people who inhabit an enduring city-state at the edge of an active volcano. Molten rock and slag from this sacred volcano is used in the heated shot for their destructive cannonry, and their soldiers wield blades forged in its fires.
Seafolk who forsake cannons and muskets. They sail low-profile catamarans and set upon their foes with stealthy ambushes.
People who dwell in island highlands. They largely forsake the sea, but send out seafaring envoys to build ties with other communities.
Beast-bonded people who commune with magnificent elder rays. They are sworn to protect the seas from hunters and despoilers.
Scrappy seafolk who range far among the islands. They maintain a floating trade settlement open to any who visit with shuttered gunports.
Recent refugees of a cataclysmic war. They are desperate to gain allies against the enemy they believe will follow them to the isles.
Reclusive people who trace their lineage to the first inhabitants of the isles. They are sworn to protect the sacred sites and relics of their ancient forebears.

organizations.name: Organizations
organizations.summary: People joined in a collective trade, pursuit, or goal

rows.text2: Bands of scavenging shipbreakers who lie in wait along hazardous passages. They believe that painting their faces with a death-like visage protect against retribution by spirits of the dead.
Guild of scientists and naturalists who record their findings in exhaustively-detailed journals. Their works are copied and recorded by archivists at a grand central library.
Covert insurgency of spies and saboteurs. They seek to cripple imperial ambitions from within, and use trained gulls to carry vital messages to collaborators.
Renegades sailing in defiance of imperial powers. They conceal their identities behind iron masks to protect kinfolk still under imperial rule.
Powerful clan of pirates led by a marauder known as the Raven Queen. They recently sacked and seized a major port town and made it a refuge for outlaws and outcasts.
Guild of shipbuilders and arms manufacturers who supply their destructive wares to the highest bidder. They secretly incite wars to expand their fortune.
Mystic coven that draw their powers from the dance of the moons and the rhythm of the tides. They recruit and train talented initiates from across the isles.
Mariners bound to an age-old seafaring fellowship. They recognize fellow saltbloods and communicate using complex hand signals.
Smugglers who ferry their ill-gotten goods from island to island. They rely on speed, stealth, and the cover of foul weather or moonless nights.
Peddlers who range across the isles and beyond. They transport rare and unusual cargo aboard their vibrantly painted ships.

empires.name: Empires
empires.summary: People seeking dominion over the isles

rows.text2: Trade company that commands a fleet of beast-hunting ships and pays bounties on beasts to independent captains. Their unscrupulous merchants deal in trophies and resources gathered from slain creatures.

Loyalists of a fallen empire who seek to restore their former glory among the isles, guided by a charismatic and shrewd military leader. The sails of their ships are emblazoned with a burning phoenix.
Age-old dominion ruled by an immortal god-emperor. Their ostentatious ships are adorned with gold metalwork and filigreed sails.
Fracturing empire facing a succession crisis in the aftermath of the monarch’s assassination. Rival claimants gather their armies and navies to take the crown by force.
Iron-fisted theocracy under the rule of a council of priests. Their mandates are enforced by red-robed inquisitors.
Expansive empire with far-flung territories. Their holdings within the isles are overseen by corrupt and squabbling governors, each vying for greater power and wealth.
Powerful trade company with diverse holdings and boundless political influence. They function as a shadow government behind other powers.
War-mongering clans newly united under a powerful warlord. Their warships are fitted with imposing rams and heavy boarding ramps.

Ambitious empire that wields a powerful military. At the vanguard of their fleets are the dragon-riders of the Crimson Guard, who house their steeds and launch their attacks from colossal carrier ships.
Industrialist power formed from the remnants of warring nations. They are governed by an oligarchical council whose members scheme and backstab to advance their own interests.

cursed.name: The Cursed
cursed.summary: People transformed or bound by dreadful curses

rows.text2: Ghost ships under the command of an undead imperial admiral. This vengeful wraith seeks to carry on the war that cost them their life.
Titanic ship cursed with incessant corrosion and rot. Its crew must constantly add wood, sails, and fittings from salvaged wrecks and defeated foes into this massive and unnerving chimera-craft.
An order of occultists, each bearing a blood-red tattoo on their wrist, who are dedicated to hunting and banishing the restless dead.
Cult of sailors cursed by a drowned god. Their bodies and ships are corrupted by horrible aspects of the sea—riddled with barnacles, rotting seaweed, and brackish slime.
Fleet under the command of a necromancer. The dreadful ships are festooned with bones and bloodied sails, crewed by skeletal undead, and escorted by the risen corpse of a slain behemoth.

Ships burning with unquenchable fire and crewed by bone-scorched undead. The flagship was set aflame by marauders in a port attack, and its cursed commander seeks to spread the fire to other vessels and expand the accursed fleet.
Uncanny metal automatons who are said to embody the stolen souls of dead mariners. They cruise the isles in ironclad ships.
Pirates who seized a forbidden treasure. They are cursed with a ceaseless, insatiable hunger to hoard riches from all corners of the isles.
Dread ships of the vampire clans, shrouded in an eternal gloom. Their undead crews leave wrecks and blood-drained corpses in their wake.
Devout cultists who were granted eternal life in exchange for unending service to their patron sea god. They must not tarry on land or at anchor, lest death catches up with them to take its toll.

rows.text: Abandoned a life of privilege or power
Betrayed by a close friend, lover, or family member
Caught up in a forbidden or unlikely romance
Following in the footsteps of famous or notorious kin
Forcefully exiled from your land or people
Found adrift with no memory of your former life
Framed for a crime you didn't commit
Guided by a dream or prophecy
Home destroyed by disaster or war
Home occupied by an enemy faction
Joined a mutiny, uprising, or rebellion
Living under a stolen or assumed identity
On the run with a stolen object of great value
Raised by or fell in with criminals or pirates
Survived a disaster or battle at sea
Took up a vendetta against a powerful figure or faction
Trained in a rare or secret craft by a skilled mentor
Trying to forget a disastrous love affair
Wronged a powerful figure or faction who seeks retribution
Banished because of uncanny nature or abilities
Bearing a relic of dreadful power
Desperate to unlock the secrets of forbidden magic
Forged and made animate by forbidden technologies
Grievously wounded and given new life by forbidden magic or technology
Haunted by the spirit of someone you failed or wronged
Home destroyed by a monstrous beast
Home destroyed by undead or inhuman foes
Killed an albatross; plagued by foul luck ever since
Sole survivor of a string of unlikely disasters
Suffered a vision of a horrible fate
Survived an attack at sea by a cursed ship
Survived an attack at sea by a monstrous sea beast
Targeted or hunted by a dreadful being

persona.name: Your Persona
persona.summary: Your two starting path assets help define your character’s core abilities, skills, and experience. If you need inspiration, use the table below as a pick-list for a persona and a pair of recommended assets. Or roll for it and let the Fates decide.

ship_history.name: Ship History
ship_history.summary: If you have a command, envision how you claimed or earned the vessel. For inspiration, use the table below. If you sail under the command of a non-player character, you can use this table to give their ship a backstory.

rows.text: Acquired in a duel of honor
Awarded by a vote of the crew, after the former captain died an untimely death
Built or refitted by a community, and granted to its captain as their emissary
Captured in battle, and awarded by the former captain
Earned in exchange for a perilous undertaking or heroic deed
Entrusted by a faction, and commanded in their service
Found as a wreck, and refitted to make it seaworthy
Inherited from a dead or missing relative or mentor
Obtained in trade for a precious object
Obtained through a false identity or counterfeit documents
On grant from an underworld figure in exchange for completing unscrupulous missions
Once a timeworn, unwanted ship, painstakingly refitted to its new role
Purchased at a suspiciously cheap price
Seized in a mutiny against its former captain
Stolen from under the nose of a powerful faction
Taken while fleeing an attack or disaster
Awarded by its former—and now dead—captain, who still haunts its decks
Bound to a role as its new commander by a beguiling curse
Cobbled together from salvage found within a graveyard of forsaken ships
Discovered within a hidden sea cave after calling to you in a dream
Found adrift in perfect condition, with no sign of the crew
Gifted by a dreadful entity in exchange for a dark favor; you reneged on their terms
Granted in an accursed agreement, sealed in blood
Improbably found as a derelict well inland; moved and refloated with much effort
Raised from the sunken depths as a boon from the sea itself
Taken in spite of its cursed reputation, when no one else would sail it

crew.name: Crew Characteristics
crew.summary: Envision the makeup of the ship’s crew, using the table below for inspiration. Rolling for a result can inspire details for your own background and potential quests—or it may put you at odds with a crew that is contrary to your nature and goals.

rows.text: Eclectic mix of all sorts of folk
Adventurers and trailblazers, seeking the far horizon
Disciplined military force, doing their duty
Experienced mariners, lending an able hand
Glory hunters, looking to make a mark
Kin of a seafaring people, honoring traditions
Marauders and brigands, taking their share of the spoils
Novice mariners, undertaking their first adventure
Old salts brought out of retirement, undertaking a final adventure
Outcasts and exiles, bound by their differences
Refugees from a faraway land, finding a new home
Survivors of a horrible cataclysm, preserving what remains
Survivors of a terrible attack, seeking revenge
Turncoat imperials, sworn against former compatriots
Roll twice; these groups are at odds

crew_cursed.name: Cursed Crew
crew_cursed.summary: If you roll a curse for Crew Characteristics, take your result on that table and give them an eerie, supernatural, or dreadful aspect. Use the table below for inspiration.

rows.text: Bound to the ship, unable to sail another
Bound to the will of a dreadful artifact
Built or augmented with strange technologies
Cursed with foreknowledge of a dreadful fate
Hunted by a vengeful sea beast
In the service of a malevolent god or entity
Obsessed with superstitious routines and rituals
Once dead, now cursed with unnatural life
Suffers a jinxed reputation, and forsaken by others
Survivors of an attack by a horrifying foe or monstrous beast

rows.text3: Most sharks offer little threat, but certain species of large, aggressive sharks are properly feared and respected by seagoing folk. Mariners also speak of ancient sharks, relentless hunters the size of whales whose teeth splinter hull and bone alike.

The seas teem with whales of all sorts. Even the largest of them, the great whales, are generally friendly and curious. They are nevertheless under threat by whalers and despoilers, and some islanders sail in defense of these gentle creatures.

These ancient whales are far larger and more aggressive than their common kin. Their bone-white hide bears the scars of harpoon strikes and hard-won battles with other beasts. They are keenly intelligent, have long memories, and do not forgive or forget.

Circling carrion birds and the stench of death often forewarn the appearance of a rothulk, a cadaverous but still animate great whale. These unfortunate beasts are infested by a multitude of parasites that bind grasping tendrils to flesh and bone. The small creatures steal the life of their host and puppeteer what remains.
The largest of these creatures can easily crush a longboat with their powerful tentacles, but they only reluctantly emerge from the lightless depths that is their preferred hunting grounds.

The Kraken is the singular master of the seas, a beast of horrific scale, cunning, and ferocity. It has the sleek form and speed of a giant whale, but is armed with powerful tentacles and a gaping, toothy maw. Along its flank are rows of luminescent eyes; doom lights, mariners call them, for they are a presage of certain death.

These aquatic dragons have glittering scales, toothy jaws, and long, bladed tails. Their winglike fins propel them through the water at amazing speeds, and send them leaping and gliding over the waves.
Like their lesser brethren, these creatures have flattened bodies and broad fins. They are inherently gentle, often traveling with seafolk who recognize individual rays by their luminescent markings.
These creatures are about the length of a sloop, with long necks, broad bodies, and turtle-like fins. They are not overly aggressive, but often hound fishing boats in hopes of stealing their catch.

These masses of black-eyed, sharp-toothed eels rely on sheer numbers to overwhelm larger prey. Some say they are capable of chewing through a ship’s hull, and pour into a breached vessel in a slithering, biting torrent.

These titanic beasts have sinuous bodies, glittering scales, and spiny red fins larger than the greatest mainsail. They are largely ambivalent to the presence of most seagoing folk—all but the largest ship passes beneath their notice.
The shells of these gigantic, squat crustaceans are encrusted with coral and sea life, camouflaging them among reef systems. They are territorial and protective of their habitats.

Hundreds of pinpoint lights shimmer within the translucent form of these gigantic jellyfish. According to legend, the lights of a starlume reveal complex celestial maps. Those who look deeply into those alluring lights may find themselves gifted—or cursed—with visions of lost seas and hidden places.

From a distance, this titanic entity might be mistaken for a great whale, but it is a crewless metal construct that wanders the seas on an inscrutable mission. Its rotating maw generates powerful whirlpools to draw in prey, sending ship and sailor alike into an ever-burning furnace deep within its mechanical gullet.

These colossal tortoise-like beings are the longest-lived creatures of the isles—perhaps as ancient as the world itself. Islanders interpret wondrous and grim portents from the sighting of a herald, but these creatures often go unseen; their craggy shell is easily mistaken for a small, rocky island.
Generate this beast using the Starforged creature oracles (page 336 of the Starforged rulebook), giving it a water form.

Big cats are the most common land predator in the isles. Some live among the high branches of jungle canopies, climbing and leaping with ease. Others dwell within the shadows of the forest floor or amid the rocks and crags of highland terrain, stalking their prey with deadly skill.
Reapers are bipedal, cunning reptiles who move in packs, striking unseen from the shadows and chasing prey into flanking ambushes. They dispatch their quarry with wicked, sickle-shaped claws.

The towering great apes of the isles live in the most rugged and remote jungles. They are reclusive creatures and do not abide rivals or trespassers. Their long lives are marked by the innumerable scars of fights with other beasts.

This bipedal reptile is feared for its towering size, toothy maw, and dreadful roar. A small circlet of bone rings the beast’s skull, leading some to name the thundermaw a king among the isles. Despite its legendary reputation, the thundermaw prefers to scavenge its meals, and tires easily when giving chase.

This titanic, reptilian beast dwells within deep jungles and mountainous highlands. It is a creature of the ancient world, unconcerned with the petty affairs of island folk but protective of its mist-shrouded domain. It is taller than the highest jungle canopy, and leaves trails of splintered trees and sundered earth in its wake.

These person-sized, flightless birds are drawn to shiny things, and collect bits of stone, metal, and trinkets in their nests. They are jealously protective of this hoard. When a trespasser comes near, they use a chittering call and display of colorful plumage to warn them away. If that fails, their surprising jumping ability, razor-like claws, and sharp beak make quick work of any threat.

These majestic, nomadic creatures have prehensile trunks, long tusks, and spiraling horns. The largest and oldest of a herd, the matriarch, is covered in a layer of moss, lichen, and plant sprigs—it wears this lush garden like an elaborate, earthy cape. Birds roost along the matriarch’s back and circle above while the herd travels, providing a squawking alarm when danger is near.

The serrabrus is a large boar-like beast. It is an industrious creature, felling trees, gathering deadwood, and building crude barriers with its sweeping, sawtooth tusks. To find oneself lost within the strange, meandering fences of the serrabrus is to incite the rage of the builder.

These enormous spiders have a sleek, obsidian exoskeleton and slender legs tipped with razor-sharp hooks. They lurk in shadowy places—such as grounded shipwrecks, deep caves, and dense woodlands—building elaborate webs as traps for unwary prey.

This gargantuan, insect-like creature moves through woodlands on multi-jointed legs the size of tree trunks. It often stands perfectly still while lying in wait for prey, indiscernible from the surrounding wilds.

The scales of this massive, canopy-dwelling snake can shift in hue and texture, allowing it to blend invisibly within its surroundings. After grasping its unaware prey, the mimic serpent coils around its victim, stealing air and crushing bones.

These pale rats of unusual size are accustomed to life within lightless caves. Ghost rats are blind, and use their keen sense of smell to navigate the depths. They pursue potential meals with hound-like persistence.

This large, cave-dwelling insect contorts its long limbs with uncanny flexibility—the joints cracking like breaking bones—to navigate the smallest crevices. These limbs, equipped with delicate sensory organs, enable the creature to perceive the subtlest vibrations and detect prey or threats from afar. After unfolding itself from its hiding place, the gangle attacks with a spray of burning saliva.

These ancient dragons lair in volcanic chambers, hibernating for centuries amid superheated steam and gases. They are flightless, with only vestigial wings, but their titanic scale and molten breath mark them as the greatest of dragon-kind. The rare emergence of a deep dragon from its burrow is a catastrophic reckoning for the surface world.
Generate this beast using the Starforged creature oracles (page 336 of the Starforged rulebook), giving it a land form.

shore_and_river.name: Beasts of the Shore and River

rows.text3: Large crocodiles dwell in waters throughout the isles, including coastal wetlands, rivers, and the depths of tidal caves. The greatest and fiercest of them are the size of a sloop­­ —armed with dagger-like teeth, impenetrable hides, and powerful tails capable of shattering stone.

This beast dwells within shoreline hollows and sea caves. It is a cunning and patient creature, slumbering for months or years until hapless prey wanders into its dark lair. As it awakens, its orb-like eyes glimmer with a foul, hungry light, and its barbed tentacles prepare to strike.

These semi-aquatic arachnids trap air with their silk, enabling them to hunt along riverbeds and coastal shallows, or lurk along the shore in wait of prey. They occasionally get caught up in nets, an unlucky catch for fisher folk.

This creature lurks within the mire of swamps and muddy rivers. What the muck toad lacks in speed and agility, it makes up for in strength and scale, grasping prey with its prehensile tongue and swallowing it whole with its cavernous maw.

Sand dragons are the smallest of dragon-kind, but are still a fearsome foe. Burrowing beneath shoreline dunes, it stirs at the telltale vibrations of footfalls upon its lair. It attacks with dagger-like claws, teeth as long and wicked as cutlasses, and breath of scalding steam.

The keelback crab uses a scavenged ship as a protective shell for its soft exoskeleton. Reports of ghost ships can often be attributed to keelbacks, scuttling along coastal waters with wrecks on their backs. As it grows, a keelback must commandeer vessels of increasing size.

The jade crab is the largest and most aggressive of the crustaceans, able to snap a longboat or even a small ship in two with its vice-like pincers. At rest, their shell is slate gray, easily mistaken for rocks or reefs. On the hunt, they shimmer with an iridescent blue-green. Fiercely territorial, these creatures often claim a waterway, cove, or sea cave as their lair.
Generate this beast using the Starforged creature oracles (page 336 of the Starforged rulebook), giving it a land or water form.

Various types of enormous hawks hunt among the isles, including the mangrove-dwelling ash hawk and the coastal wind reaver. The greatest of them, the fabled vastwing, is said to be capable of grasping and lifting a fully loaded longboat in its enormous talons.

The most common dragon of the isles, the iron dragon dwells in a variety of environments, from rocky coasts to deep inland jungles. They have a tough hide the color of weathered iron, dreadful claws, and a long, powerful tail. But their most potent weapon is their fiery breath, the bane of any wooden ship that earns their ire. Some island folk revere these creatures. But others harness them and ride into battle, launching from a seaside fort or a ship’s deck to lay waste to their enemies.

These winged reptilian beasts nest along waterside cliffs, and are adept at diving to spear fish with barbed beaks. Fishing boats and cargo ships often fall prey to wave skimmer ambushes, as the cunning predators have learned of the great bounties hidden within those vessels.
Scavengers by nature, the vulture-sized goregulls feed primarily on dead sea life, but are known to harass the crews of floundering ships.

These oversized bats, large enough to carry off an unlucky islander, dwell in caves and amid jungle canopies. As the sun sets, they leave their roosts to hunt. They are particularly dangerous on moonless nights when their swift, silent approach goes unnoticed.
Bloodmites are hound-sized, flying insects. They primarily cling to the hide of titanic beasts, feeding through a blade-tipped proboscis, but are not averse to preying upon smaller targets.

These moth-like creatures are unsettlingly large but harmless. They are often seen on nights when Wraith is full—they shimmer with a strange, ethereal glow, as if reflecting the light of the moon. Many islanders believe they escort souls into the world beyond. Look too long into their alluring glow, they say, and you suffer a glimpse of your own death.
Generate this beast using the Starforged creature oracles (page 336 of the Starforged rulebook), giving it an air form.

character.name: Character Oracles
character.summary: When encountering a character, focus on what you learn or perceive as a first impression using tables such as [First Look](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/character/first_look) and [Initial Disposition](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/character/initial_disposition). Then envision or generate additional details over time.

roles.name: Character Roles
roles.summary: Envision a character’s background or occupation using the broad categories below. For more detail, check the related subtable.

trademark_accessories.name: Trademark Accessories
trademark_accessories.summary: This table includes conspicuous gear, adornment, and clothing. Use it to help envision the look of a notable character, particularly one who is a seafarer or adventurer. To arm them with a favorite weapon, check [Trademark Weapons](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/character/trademark_weapons).

rows.text: Baldric with a buckle of a monstrous face
Bandoleer stocked with vials and flasks
Collection of keys hung from an iron ring
Ear pendant with a glimmering gem
False eye carved from a gemstone
Large tattoo of a legendary beast
Tailcoat with gold trim and epaulets

rows.text: Adorned with bone or skull motifs
Consumes the souls of its victims

details.name: Character Details
details.summary: As you interact with a person to gain a deeper understanding of their nature and personality, roll on this table to reveal new characteristics. Feel free to ignore, reroll, or adjust contradictions. Or envision how those contradictions add interesting complexity to the character.

name.name: Character Name
name.description:
This table provides pairs of given and family names. When choosing or rolling for a character name, select a pair or mix and match from among the options in a row. Given and family names can often be reversed, or used independently as stand-alone names.

This table also includes monikers, one to each row. Not all characters have monikers, but sailors are often given a nickname by their shipmates, or adopt one of their own. Monikers can be used as a stand-alone name (for example, “Redbeard” or “Stormcrow”) or paired with a given name or family name (“Crimson Jack” or “Hardtack Hobbs”). Roll or select an appropriate moniker as you like.

moniker_cursed.name: Cursed Moniker
moniker_cursed.summary: Use these tables to reveal an epitaph for a dreadful, eldritch, ill-fated, or mechanical character. For example, a pirate captain who adopts a much-feared identity would have a [Dreadful Persona](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/character/name/moniker_cursed/dreadful_persona). A wretched, outcast mariner would have an [Ill-Fated Nature](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/character/name/moniker_cursed/ill_fated_nature). Use the result alone, combine with a name, or pair results from two Cursed Moniker categories.

type.name: Faction Type
type.summary: On a cursed result, choose one: Make the faction one of [The Cursed](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/faction/cursed/role), or keep the result and give the faction [Cursed Aspects](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/faction/cursed/aspects).

relationship.name: Faction Relationship
relationship.summary: When you have a question about the relationship of one faction to another—or how an individual relates to a faction—use this table. The result is the commonly understood connection, but might not tell the whole story.

society.name: Society
society.summary: People who share traditions and a way of life

chronicles.name: Society Chronicles
chronicles.summary: Use this table to generate a history of notable events that shaped a society. Create a timeline of two or three milestones, envisioning how they led the society to its current place among the isles. The most recent event can help inspire a current situation that creates troubles or opportunities for these people.

touchstones.summary: These touchstones represent common aspects of a society—not universal truths. Individual people and communities can contradict these assumptions with their own touchstones. If you encounter a far-flung community that is part of a known society, you can recheck this table for unique characteristics.

cursed.name: The Cursed
cursed.summary: For cursed factions that function as an organization, use the [Organization Methods](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/faction/organization/methods) or [Organization Secrets](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/faction/organization/secrets) tables for additional details. To reveal a current goal for a cursed faction or its leaders, use the [Cursed Character Goals](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/character/goals_cursed) table. You can also give a cursed faction one or more [Cursed Aspects](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/faction/cursed/aspects).

role.name: Role
role.summary: Cursed factions include people and beings of a strange, supernatural, or dreadful nature, as well as factions dedicated to opposing those entities. Use the table below to reveal the role of a cursed faction.

rows.text: Roll twice; combine those results as a single faction or set them against each other as opposing factions

story_complication.name: Story Complication
story_complication.summary: This oracle will introduce narrative turns, troubles, and revelations. It can be used as an alternative to the [Pay the Price](oracle_rollable:move:starforged/pay_the_price) table when you encounter a negative outcome at a crucial moment. In particular, you might use this table after rolling matched 10s on the challenge dice.

rows.text: Crucial resource or equipment is sabotaged

story_clue.name: Story Clue
story_clue.summary: When you [Gather Information](move:starforged/adventure/gather_information) to investigate a mystery, you might uncover clues in the form of messages, records, rumors, eyewitness reports, or physical evidence. You can use this oracle to help reveal what this evidence connects to or implicates. Then, use the outcome of the [Gather Information](move:starforged/adventure/gather_information) roll—strong hit, weak hit, or miss—to guide whether the clue brings clarity or complications.

repository.name: Treasure Repository
repository.summary: Choose the scale of the treasure’s repository—small, medium, large, or vast—as appropriate to situation and location. See the examples in the table below. If unsure, roll for the answer. The result helps set the potential Value of the treasure.

rows.text2: Strongbox; desk drawer; bag or pouch

aspects.name: Treasure Aspects
aspects.summary: Use this table to reveal characteristics of a treasure or its surroundings. Since the results often involve twists and complications, it is best reserved for notable finds and dramatic situations. Also, keep in mind that an aspect might be outside your character’s immediate viewpoint—if so, make note of it as a future trouble or opportunity.

precious_items.name: Precious Items
precious_items.summary: Roll or select a number of items on this table as set by the treasure’s [Value](oracle_collection:sundered_isles/treasure/value). Each result represents a quantity of that item, such as a strongbox filled with pearls, barrels of aged rum, or a stack of precious metal ingots. To instead reveal a specific item of intrinsic or personal worth, check the [Tokens](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/treasure/tokens) table.

rows.text: Cache of coins, gems, and jewels

tokens.name: Tokens
tokens.summary: A token is an item of personal significance—such as a memento, heirloom, or individual treasure. Use this table when prompted by the [Precious Items](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/treasure/precious_items) table, or to add detail to a character. A token might have intrinsic value, but is often a thing of worth only to its owner. Not all treasures are silver and gold.

abilities.text: Your albatross companion brings good luck, but its fate is tied to your own. When you are at sea, increase your momentum reset by 1. If the albatross is killed, discard this asset and suffer a permanent impact.

When the albatross flies ahead of your ship or perches on the ship’s mast as you [Finish an Expedition](move:starforged/exploration/finish_an_expedition), its luck is on your side. You may reroll one challenge die.

conditions.text: When the albatross flies ahead of your ship or perches on the ship’s mast as you [Finish an Expedition](move:starforged/exploration/finish_an_expedition)

abilities.text: When you [Secure an Advantage](move:starforged/adventure/secure_an_advantage) at sea by asking the spirit embodied by the albatross for a favorable boon, you may roll +its health. If you do, take +1 momentum on a hit. On a strong hit with a match, also mark 1 tick on your bonds legacy track as you deepen your connection to your companion.

conditions.text: at sea by asking the spirit embodied by the albatross for a favorable boon

abilities.text:
This animate skull does not use a health meter, but is as vulnerable to destruction or loss as any object. When you make a move in its presence, add a cursed die (ten-sided) to the roll. If that die rolls a 10, you glean insight from the skull’s incessant chatter as follows.

  * If you rolled a miss, reroll all dice. If you miss again, the skull leads you astray.
  * If you rolled a hit, take +1 momentum and add +1 on your next related move.

conditions.text: When you make a move in the chattering skull's presence

abilities.text: When you roll a match with a 10 on the cursed die, you learn a surprising or dreadful aspect of the skull’s history or nature; mark 1 box on your bonds legacy track.
Once per situation, when you make a move against a supernatural foe, obstacle, or mystery, you may use the value of the cursed die in place of your action die.

conditions.text: Once per situation, when you make a move against a supernatural foe, obstacle, or mystery

abilities.text: Your dolphin companion is a helpful but often errant friend. When you call the dolphin, roll +heart. On a hit, it appears and will remain in the area for an hour or two. You may (one time only) reroll any dice on a move to overcome an obstacle or hazard with its help. On a strong hit, also take +2 momentum. On a miss, it is away or unable to respond; [Pay the Price](move:starforged/fate/pay_the_price).

call_dolphin.name: Call Dolphin

trigger.text: When you call the dolphin...

call_dolphin.text: Your dolphin companion is a helpful but often errant friend. When you call the dolphin, roll +heart. On a hit, it appears and will remain in the area for an hour or two. You may (one time only) reroll any dice on a move to overcome an obstacle or hazard with its help. On a strong hit, also take +2 momentum. On a miss, it is away or unable to respond; [Pay the Price](move:starforged/fate/pay_the_price).

strong_hit.text: On a __strong hit__, it appears and will remain in the area for an hour or two. Take +2 momentum. You may (one time only) reroll any dice on a move to overcome an obstacle or hazard with its help.

weak_hit.text: On a __weak hit__, it appears and will remain in the area for an hour or two. You may (one time only) reroll any dice on a move to overcome an obstacle or hazard with its help.

miss.text: On a __miss__, it is away or unable to respond; [Pay the Price](move:starforged/fate/pay_the_price).

abilities.text: When you make a move to detect or evade a threat while swimming in the company of the dolphin, roll +its health and take +1 momentum on a hit.

conditions.text: When you make a move to detect or evade a threat while swimming in the company of the dolphin

abilities.text: When you [Undertake an Expedition](move:starforged/exploration/undertake_an_expedition) and score a miss with a match, you may envision the dolphin appearing unbidden to guide you out of trouble. If you do, reroll both challenge dice.

Your dragon companion wards off trouble. When you [Secure an Advantage](move:starforged/adventure/secure_an_advantage) by letting it roam, roll +its health. You must [Sacrifice Resources](move:starforged/suffer/sacrifice_resources) (-1) about once a day to satiate its fierce appetite; otherwise, make the [Companion Takes a Hit](move:starforged/suffer/companion_takes_a_hit) (-2) move.

conditions.text: by letting your dragon roam

abilities.text: The dragon accepts you as a rider. It flies under your direction, and assails your foes using tooth, tail, claw, and fiery breath. When you make a move from the saddle to lead an expedition or leverage the dragon as a weapon, you may roll +its health. If you then roll a 1 or 2 on your action die, the dragon must bear the brunt of any cost or counterattack.
When you make the [Companion Takes a Hit](move:starforged/suffer/companion_takes_a_hit) move, take +1 momentum on a strong hit.

Your jungle cat companion leaps into the fight at your side. When you [Strike](move:starforged/combat/strike) aided by the cat, or if you make a move to intimidate your foes, add +1. If you [Clash](move:starforged/combat/clash), take +1 momentum on a hit.

conditions.text: aided by the jungle cat
make a move to intimidate your foes, aided by the jungle cat
aided by the jungle cat

abilities.text: The jungle cat leads the way on treacherous overland journeys. When you [Undertake an Expedition](move:starforged/exploration/undertake_an_expedition) through wilderness, add +1. On a strong hit with a match, the cat guides you to an otherwise unseen opportunity; envision what you find and take +2 momentum.

conditions.text: When you [Undertake an Expedition](move:starforged/exploration/undertake_an_expedition) through wilderness

abilities.text: When you [Endure Stress](move:starforged/suffer/endure_stress) in the company of the jungle cat, or if you [Hearten](move:starforged/recover/hearten) in their company, add +1. On a strong hit with a match, you find inspiration or solace; take +momentum equal to their health.

conditions.text: in the company of the jungle cat

abilities.text: Your monkey companion finds its own trouble. Once per situation, when you score a miss, you may suffer the cost by envisioning the monkey causing mischief or getting into danger. If you do, roll +its health. On a strong hit, the monkey unwittingly turns the situation in your favor; take +2 momentum. On a weak hit, it provides a distraction or mild boon; take +1 momentum. On a miss, it faces its own cost or makes the situation worse.

monkey_business.name: Suffer Monkey Business

trigger.text: Once per situation, when you score a miss, and you suffer the cost by envisioning the monkey causing mischief or getting into danger...

monkey_business.text: Your monkey companion finds its own trouble. Once per situation, when you score a miss, you may suffer the cost by envisioning the monkey causing mischief or getting into danger. If you do, roll +its health. On a strong hit, the monkey unwittingly turns the situation in your favor; take +2 momentum. On a weak hit, it provides a distraction or mild boon; take +1 momentum. On a miss, it faces its own cost or makes the situation worse.

strong_hit.text: On a __strong hit__, the monkey unwittingly turns the situation in your favor; take +2 momentum.

weak_hit.text: On a __weak hit__, the monkey provides a distraction or mild boon; take +1 momentum.

miss.text: On a __miss__, the monkey faces its own cost or makes the situation worse.

abilities.text: When you make a move by sending the monkey to complete a task involving theft, infiltration, or sabotage, roll +its health. On a hit, take +1 momentum.

conditions.text: When you make a move by sending the monkey to complete a task involving theft, infiltration, or sabotage

abilities.text: When you [Resupply](move:starforged/recover/resupply) by asking the monkey to search or scavenge, add +1.

conditions.text: When you [Resupply](move:starforged/recover/resupply) by asking the monkey to search or scavenge

abilities.text: Your parrot companion offers random wisdom. When you seek inspiration, context, or direction, use your oracle dice to choose a table (1–25: [Action](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/core/action), 26–50: [Theme](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/core/theme), 51–75: [Descriptor](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/core/descriptor), 76–100: [Focus](oracle_rollable:sundered_isles/core/focus)). Then, roll to learn what your parrot says. If you connect this prompt to your current situation for new insight, take +1 momentum.
Once per fight, when you score a miss, you may envision how the parrot appears on the scene to cause a timely distraction. If you do, make it a strong hit instead.

The parrot squawks a warning when danger is near. When you [Face Danger](move:starforged/adventure/face_danger) to detect a threat, or if you [Enter the Fray](move:starforged/combat/enter_the_fray) against an ambush, add +its health.

conditions.text: When you [Enter the Fray](move:starforged/combat/enter_the_fray) against an ambush
When you [Face Danger](move:starforged/adventure/face_danger) to detect a threat

abilities.text: Your rat companion shows the way. When you make a move to flee a danger aboard a ship or within a confined site, and let your rat take the lead, add +its health.

conditions.text: When you make a move to flee a danger aboard a ship or within a confined site, and let your rat take the lead

abilities.text: When you make a move by setting loose the rat to cause a distraction or commotion among a crowd or in a public space, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit. On a strong hit with a match, it creates unexpected chaos; take +1 momentum more.

conditions.text: When you make a move by setting loose the rat to cause a distraction or commotion among a crowd or in a public space

abilities.text: You may [Explore a Waypoint](move:starforged/exploration/explore_a_waypoint) (even if not on an expedition) by sending the rat to search a promising confined area for something of interest or value. If you do, roll +its health. On a miss, its instincts have you forewarned; you may reroll one challenge die.

conditions.text: by sending the rat to search a promising confined area for something of interest or value (even if not on an expedition)

kraken.name: The Kraken
kraken.requirement: While it is your companion, the Kraken cannot be harmed.

abilities.text: When you summon the Kraken, fill one segment of a four-segment clock. The Kraken will heed a single command to destroy or overcome any foe or obstacle. If you are in a fight, [Take Decisive Action](move:starforged/combat/take_decisive_action) with an automatic strong hit. When the clock is filled, [Ask the Oracle](oracle_rollable:move:starforged/ask_the_oracle/fifty_fifty) (using the yes/no table) if the Kraken turns against you, making it 50/50. On a yes, discard this asset; the Kraken is now an epic foe. On a no, clear one segment of the clock.

conditions.text: When you summon the Kraken in a fight

abilities.text: When you make a move using a threat to call the Kraken as leverage, add +2.

conditions.text: When you make a move using a threat to call the Kraken as leverage

abilities.text: One time only, when you [Fulfill Your Vow](move:starforged/quest/fulfill_your_vow) (formidable or greater) in service to the Kraken and score a hit, choose one: clear all clock segments, or discard this asset and mark three boxes on your bonds legacy track.

conditions.text: One time only, when you [Fulfill Your Vow](move:starforged/quest/fulfill_your_vow) (formidable or greater) in service to the Kraken

cohort.name: Cohort
cohort.requirement: Once you accept a connection as a crewmate...

abilities.text: You gain a specialist. The specialist is part of your crew, but is tracked as a connection and provides benefits to you and your allies per their role. When you [Withstand Damage](move:starforged/suffer/withstand_damage) and score a miss, or if you [Pay the Price](move:starforged/fate/pay_the_price), you may suffer the cost by noting the specialist as out of action. An out of action specialist provides no benefit. To restore a specialist to duty, resolve the situation as appropriate to the nature of the injury, trauma, or dispute.
Gain additional specialists by spending 1 experience to add a connection to your crew as a specialist. Specialist bonuses may not be stacked for a single action.
When you [Secure an Advantage](move:starforged/adventure/secure_an_advantage) by gathering your specialists to strategize or problem-solve, you may reroll one die for each participating specialist.

conditions.text: By gathering your specialists to strategize or problem-solve

damned.name: Damned
damned.requirement: Once you mark tormented or doomed...

abilities.text: You are cursed and remade by your encounter with death or desolation. Discard two or more assets connected to your former nature, and take up to three assets to represent your damned existence. Give the new assets a special mark. When you [Advance](move:starforged/legacy/advance) and upgrade a damned asset, spend 1 experience (instead of 2).

conditions.text: When you [Advance](move:starforged/legacy/advance) and upgrade a damned asset

abilities.text: Choose a community where you are accepted despite (or because of) your cursed nature. When you [Sojourn](move:starforged/recover/sojourn) there, reroll any dice.

conditions.text: In the community where you are accepted despite (or because of) your cursed nature

abilities.text: When your curse is broken through the fulfillment of a vow or other event, activate this ability at no cost. Discard this asset and any of your damned assets, exchanging them one-for-one for new assets with an equal number of marked abilities. You may then improve one of your stats by +1.

fleet_commander.name: Fleet Commander
fleet_commander.requirement: Once you fill 16 legacy track boxes and take command of a mighty fleet...

abilities.text: Your fleet has a starting and max power of 4. When you make a move as a fleetwide action to get in position, avoid a hazard, or fight, roll +power. If your fleet bears the cost of a move, suffer -1 power. At 0 power, mark the fleet as wrecked. To refit the fleet, [Sojourn](move:starforged/recover/sojourn) and forgo an automatic strong hit on a recover move to take +2 power; if the fleet is wrecked, first spend 2 experience to clear that status.

conditions.text: When you make a move as a fleetwide action to get in position, avoid a hazard, or fight

abilities.text: Take +2 power and set your max power to 5.
When you [Undertake an Expedition](move:starforged/exploration/undertake_an_expedition), you may reroll your action die if its value is less than your fleet’s power.

old_salt.name: Old Salt
old_salt.requirement: Once you fill 4 boxes each on your discovery and bonds legacy tracks...

abilities.text: You are accustomed to a life at sea. When you set sail after a landlocked layover, take +2 momentum or +2 spirit, or +1 of each. When you make landfall, [Lose Momentum](move:sundered_isles/suffer/lose_momentum) (-1).

When you [Secure an Advantage](move:sundered_isles/adventure/secure_an_advantage) to plot a course through careful study of currents and weather, or if you [Face Danger](move:sundered_isles/adventure/face_danger) aboard ship to overcome or avoid an environmental hazard such as a storm or rogue wave, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

conditions.text: to plot a course through careful study of currents and weather
aboard ship to overcome or avoid an environmental hazard such as a storm or rogue wave

abilities.text: When you make a move to hunt, oppose, study, pacify, or gain the favor of a sea creature, add +1. On a strong hit with a match, envision the surprising insight or affinity you gain; mark 1 tick on your discoveries or bonds legacy track.

conditions.text: When you make a move to hunt, oppose, study, pacify, or gain the favor of a sea creature

undead.name: Undead
undead.requirement: Once you die or are cursed with undeath...

abilities.text: This is not your end. Envision your undead form and nature. This asset counts as a permanent impact, but you are now resistant to mortal harm. When you [Endure Harm](move:starforged/suffer/endure_harm), you may first [Lose Momentum](move:starforged/suffer/lose_momentum) (-1, -2, or -3) to offset an equal amount of harm. If potential harm remains, and you choose to resist the harm, roll +spirit.

conditions.text: If harm remains after you [Lose Momentum](move:starforged/suffer/lose_momentum), and you choose to resist it

abilities.text: When you make a move using your undead aspect to intimidate, scare, or confound, reroll any dice; on a hit, take +2 momentum.

conditions.text: When you make a move using your undead aspect to intimidate, scare, or confound

abilities.text: You may move at will between the mortal world and the realm of the dead, can take others with you, and may navigate those paths to bypass or hasten a mortal journey. When you [Undertake an Expedition](move:starforged/exploration/undertake_an_expedition) within the realms of the dead, roll +spirit. On a strong hit, mark progress.

conditions.text: When you [Undertake an Expedition](move:starforged/exploration/undertake_an_expedition) within the realms of the dead

abilities.text: When you [Face Danger](move:starforged/adventure/face_danger) or [React Under Fire](move:starforged/combat/react_under_fire) by sailing through an obstacle or barrier, add +1. If you [Withstand Damage](move:starforged/suffer/withstand_damage) as an outcome of this action, also add +1.

conditions.text: by sailing through an obstacle or barrier
as an outcome of sailing through an obstacle or barrier

abilities.text: When you [Strike](move:starforged/combat/strike) by ramming your foe, choose the force of the hit: 1, 2, or 3. Then, add +that amount. On a strong hit, mark progress. On a weak hit or miss, in addition to the outcome of the move, [Withstand Damage](move:starforged/suffer/withstand_damage) and suffer damage equal to the force of the hit.

conditions.text: by ramming your foe

abilities.text: When you [Secure an Advantage](move:starforged/adventure/secure_an_advantage) or [Gain Ground](move:starforged/combat/gain_ground) by bringing your ship to ramming speed and sailing headlong toward a threat, roll +integrity or +heart, whichever is higher. On a strong hit, take +1 momentum.

conditions.text: by bringing your ship to ramming speed and sailing headlong toward a threat

abilities.text: Your vessel is fitted fore and aft with powerful cannons. When you [Strike](move:starforged/combat/strike) at a pursuing or fleeing target, take +1 momentum on a strong hit.

conditions.text: When you [Strike](move:starforged/combat/strike) at a pursuing or fleeing target

abilities.text: Once per fight, when you [Gain Ground](move:starforged/combat/gain_ground) by firing your chase guns to find the range of your target, add +1. On a strong hit, add +1 if you immediately [Strike](move:starforged/combat/strike), and continue to add +1 on each subsequent [Strike](move:starforged/combat/strike) as long as you remain in control. If you score a strong hit with a match when using this ability, you damage a vital component; mark progress.

conditions.text: Once per fight, when you [Gain Ground](move:starforged/combat/gain_ground) by firing your chase guns to find the range of your target

abilities.text: When you [Face Defeat](move:starforged/combat/face_defeat) in a fight and set a new objective to escape, you may (one time only) immediately [Clash](move:starforged/combat/clash) by firing your chase guns as you maneuver away from your foe; if you do, reroll any dice. On a strong hit, take +2 momentum.

conditions.text: When you [Face Defeat](move:starforged/combat/face_defeat) in a fight and set a new objective to escape

abilities.text: When you [Secure an Advantage](move:starforged/adventure/secure_an_advantage) by making a showy display of your ship, you may roll +integrity. If you do, take +1 momentum on a hit.

conditions.text: When you [Secure an Advantage](move:starforged/adventure/secure_an_advantage) by making a showy display of your ship

abilities.text: When you host a formal ceremony or reception aboard your ship, roll +heart or +integrity, whichever is higher. On a strong hit, the event goes as planned; you and any allies in attendance mark 2 ticks on your bonds legacy track. On a weak hit, as above, but you must first deal with an unfortunate conflict or interruption. On a miss, the event flops or is dramatically cut short; [Pay the Price](move:starforged/fate/pay_the_price).

host_reception.name: Host Reception

trigger.text: When you host a formal ceremony or reception aboard your ship...

host_reception.text: When you host a formal ceremony or reception aboard your ship, roll +heart or +integrity, whichever is higher. On a strong hit, the event goes as planned; you and any allies in attendance mark 2 ticks on your bonds legacy track. On a weak hit, as above, but you must first deal with an unfortunate conflict or interruption. On a miss, the event flops or is dramatically cut short; [Pay the Price](move:starforged/fate/pay_the_price).

strong_hit.text: On a __strong hit__, the event goes as planned; you and any allies in attendance mark 2 ticks on your bonds legacy track.

weak_hit.text: On a __weak hit__, you must first deal with an unfortunate conflict or interruption. After, the event goes as planned; you and any allies in attendance mark 2 ticks on your bonds legacy track.

miss.text: On a __miss__, the event flops or is dramatically cut short; [Pay the Price](move:starforged/fate/pay_the_price).

abilities.text: When you [Withstand Damage](move:starforged/suffer/withstand_damage) and the ship’s finery bears the cost, you may mark this module as broken and ignore the damage. When you [Repair](move:starforged/recover/repair) and fix this asset, take +2 momentum.

conditions.text: When you [Withstand Damage](move:starforged/suffer/withstand_damage) and the ship’s finery bears the cost
to fix the Gilded Adornments

abilities.text: You may [Secure an Advantage](move:starforged/adventure/secure_an_advantage) or [Gain Ground](move:starforged/combat/gain_ground) by firing your harpoon cannon at a large foe or threat. On a hit, the target is grappled. For the duration of the situation, if you make a move to maneuver against, attack, or board a grappled target, add +1. If you roll a 1 on your action die while taking action against a grappled target, the line is cut, broken, or works against you; [Pay the Price](move:starforged/fate/pay_the_price), and you no longer gain the bonus against that target.

conditions.text: by firing your harpoon cannon at a large foe or threat

abilities.text: As above, and if you fire the cannon in close quarters, add +2. If at a distance, take +1 momentum on a hit.

conditions.text: by firing your harpoon cannon at a large foe or threat in close quarters
by firing your harpoon cannon at a large foe or threat at a distance

abilities.text: When you [Gain Ground](move:starforged/combat/gain_ground) by maneuvering against a harpooned target to entangle or hinder, take +1 momentum on a strong hit and envision the ensuing chaos.

conditions.text: by maneuvering against a harpooned target to entangle or hinder

abilities.text: When you [Enter the Fray](move:starforged/combat/enter_the_fray) by rallying your crew to repel boarders or board an enemy ship, you may roll +supply; if you do, take +1 momentum on a hit. On a strong hit with a match, you are poised to overwhelm your foes; take +1 momentum more. In addition, any allies joining the effort may take the outcome and benefits of your move without rolling to [Enter the Fray](move:starforged/combat/enter_the_fray).

conditions.text: by rallying your crew to repel boarders or board an enemy ship

abilities.text: When you [Resupply](move:starforged/recover/resupply) by scavenging weapons or ammo from your foes after a fight, add +1.

conditions.text: by scavenging weapons or ammo from your foes after a fight

abilities.text: When you are out of options and set the fuse to self-destruct your command vehicle, activate this ability at no cost. If you do, envision how the sacrifice allows you to escape or overcome your foes amid the chaos. Then, mark 1 box on your quests legacy track and [Overcome Destruction](move:starforged/threshold/overcome_destruction).
You make the most of your provisions on a journey. When you [Set a Course](move:starforged/exploration/set_a_course), you may reroll one challenge die.

When you draw on your provisions to indulge yourself and others onboard, roll +supply and [Sacrifice Resources](move:starforged/suffer/sacrifice_resources) (-2). On a strong hit, you and your allies each choose two. On a weak hit, you each choose one. On a miss, the event is ruined by a crisis, complication, or dispute.

  * Bolster your ties: Mark 2 ticks on your bonds legacy track.
  * Build resolve: Take +2 momentum.
  * Take comfort: [Hearten](move:starforged/recover/hearten) with an automatic strong hit.
  * Gain strength: Take +2 health.

indulge_with_provisions.name: Indulge With Provisions

trigger.text: When you draw on your provisions to indulge yourself and others onboard...

indulge_with_provisions.text:
When you draw on your provisions to indulge yourself and others onboard, roll +supply and [Sacrifice Resources](move:starforged/suffer/sacrifice_resources) (-2). On a strong hit, you and your allies each choose two. On a weak hit, you each choose one. On a miss, the event is ruined by a crisis, complication, or dispute.

  * Bolster your ties: Mark 2 ticks on your bonds legacy track.
  * Build resolve: Take +2 momentum.
  * Take comfort: [Hearten](move:starforged/recover/hearten) with an automatic strong hit.
  * Gain strength: Take +2 health.

On a __strong hit__, you and your allies each choose two.

  * Bolster your ties: Mark 2 ticks on your bonds legacy track.
  * Build resolve: Take +2 momentum.
  * Take comfort: [Hearten](move:starforged/recover/hearten) with an automatic strong hit.
  * Gain strength: Take +2 health.

weak_hit.text:
On a __weak hit__, you and your allies each choose one.

  * Bolster your ties: Mark 2 ticks on your bonds legacy track.
